metadata.title: CVE-2014-9039 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
wp-login.php in WordPress before 3.7.5, 3.8.x before 3.8.5, 3.9.x before3.9.3, and 4.x before 4.0.1 might allow remote attackers to reset passwordsby leveraging access to an e-mail account that received a password-resetmessage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyseventeen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentysixteen - 4.0.1+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wordpress package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.1+dfsg-1').
